What to Check For

Verify that important event details are logged.

Why

Log events entries should include important details so that the contents of the logs are useful for forensics and system administration.

How to Check

Either examine the logs or the code that produces the logs to make sure that the following information is included in log entries:

  • User identification
  • Type of event
  • Date and time stamp
  • Success or failure indication
  • Source of event
  • Names or other identifiers of affected data or resources

How to Fix

Find code that generates log entries. Add code that records the following information in log entries:

  • User identification
  • Type of event
  • Date and time stamp
  • Success or failure indication
  • Source of event
  • Names or other identifiers of affected data or resources

Logging Guidelines

  • Centralize Logging
  • Protect Log Files
  • Log Important Event Details
  • Do Not Log Sensitive Information
  • Log Important Security Operations
  • Log Unusual Activity
  • Log Important Business Operations
  • Monitor the Use of Privileged Accounts
  • Log Authentication Events

Logging Checklists

  • Logging Is Centralized
  • Log Files Are Protected
  • Important Event Details Are Logged
  • Sensitive Information Is Not Logged
  • Important Security Operations Are Logged
  • Unusual Activity Is Logged
  • Important Business Operations Are Logged
  • The Use of Privileged Accounts Is Monitored
  • Authentication Events Are Logged
